meanings.definition: To bestow something in generous or extravagant quantities.
meanings.sent1: She lavishes love on her pets by giving them treats and toys.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy businessman lavishes gifts on his employees during the holidays.
meanings.sent3: The magician lavishes his audience with a shower of colorful confetti.
meanings.sent4: The sun lavishes its warmth on the earth, bringing life to all living things.
meanings.sent5: The chef lavishes the dish with a sprinkle of fresh herbs for added flavor.

meanings.definition: To expend or give in great amounts.
meanings.sent1: He lavishes time and effort on his hobbies, always striving for perfection.
meanings.sent2: The charity lavishes resources on helping those in need in the community.
meanings.sent3: The student lavishes excuses for not completing the assignment on time.
meanings.sent4: The river lavishes its waters on the thirsty land, quenching its dry soil.
meanings.sent5: The artist lavishes paint on the canvas, creating a masterpiece of colors and shapes.

meanings.definition: To give or expend in abundance.
meanings.sent1: She lavishes compliments on her friends, always making them feel special.
meanings.sent2: The gardener lavishes care on the plants, ensuring they thrive in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The child lavishes giggles during playtime, spreading joy to everyone around.
meanings.sent4: The storm lavishes rain on the fields, nourishing the crops and the soil.
meanings.sent5: The teacher lavishes praise on the students for their hard work and dedication.
